intro: Swida baileyi, commonly known as Bailey's swida, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, broad ovate leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
